intro: Galium jemense, commonly known as Jem's wood-roe, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs with opposite leaves. The plant features slender, erect stems that are often hairy and bear small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and typically have a serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Galium jemense thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
